title: Quality Assurance Design for Digital Educational Materials for Adult Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital device proficiency and foundational social studies literacy
context.additional_context: Facilitating collaborative learning through adult learners’ experiential sharing in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment

learning_goals: Functionality/reliability evaluation criteria for digital materials based on adult learning theory can be applied with 80% accuracy
A checklist to judge the appropriateness of digital materials during PBL activities can be created according to Kolb’s learning cycle model
The linkage between learning objectives-content-assessment in digital materials can be designed three or more times aligned with Gagné’s Nine Events of Instruction
Improvement proposals for digital materials reflecting ISO/IEC 9126 quality characteristics (usability, reliability, etc.) can be suggested

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
